page.title: 02BRIGFLATTS - GEORGE FOX
page.content: George Fox, the founder of the Quaker movement, came to Brigflatts, a hamlet of flax weavers on the banks of the river Rawthey, in 1652 after travelling through the Dales preaching in many of the villages. On nearby Firbank Fell George Fox preached a famous sermon at the spot now known as "Fox's Pulpit". An inscription reads: {LET YOUR LIVES SPEAK. {HERE OR NEAR THIS ROCK GEORGE FOX {PREACHED TO ABOUT ONE THOUSAND SEEKERS {FOR THREE HOURS ON SUNDAY JUNE 13 1652 On the nearest Sunday to this date every year a service is held in commemoration of this event. The Brigflatts Meeting House was built in 1675 and is open all year round for visitors. Last year 2,000 people signed the visitors' book.
